["Unfed - When someone hasn't been fed or nourished adequately, they may feel left hungry.", 'Undernourished - A lack of proper nutrition can result in an undernourished individual feeling continuously hungry.', "Malnourished - Severe malnutrition can lead to persistent hunger due to the body's critical need for sustenance.", "Starving - An extreme level of hunger that occurs when a person hasn't eaten for an extended period.", 'Famished - Feeling extremely hungry as if one has not had food in quite some time, often resulting from prolonged periods without nourishment.', 'Hungry stomach - A common expression to describe the physical sensation of hunger.', "Inadequately fed - When someone's diet does not provide sufficient sustenance or nutrients.", 'Underfed - Someone who has not received enough food intake, leading to a feeling of perpetual hunger.', 'Deprived of food - The act of withholding food from an individual, resulting in continuous feelings of hunger.', "Nutrient-deficient - A diet lacking essential nutrients and vitamins, often causing a constant sense of hunger due to the body's demand for proper nourishment.", 'Fasting (when unintended) - While intentional fasting can induce temporary hunger, unintentional fasting could cause ongoing feelings of being hungry if prolonged.', 'Empty belly - An expression used to describe the physical sensation and visual appearance associated with chronic hunger.', 'Goiter (indirectly related) - Though not directly linked, goiters can be a result of iodine deficiency due to poor dietary intake, which may lead to persistent feelings of hunger in some cases.', 'Vitamin deficiency - When the body lacks essential vitamins from food consumption, it can create an unfulfilled appetite as a symptom.', 'Picky eater (can lead to hunger if not addressed) - Someone who selectively consumes limited types of food may experience constant hunger due to nutritional deficiencies and inadequate intake variety.', 'Food insecurity - The ongoing lack of reliable access to sufficient quantities of affordable, nutritious food for a healthy life.', 'Underfed child - A young individual who does not receive enough food, leading them to consistently experience hunger.', "Empty pantry - An indication of insufficient food supplies in one's home environment that can result in persistent feelings of hunger.", 'Lean and gaunt (due to lack of food) - A physical appearance associated with severe or chronic malnourishment, often accompanied by continuous hunger pangs.', 'Perpetual appetite - The ongoing craving for nourishment experienced by individuals who are not adequately fed over an extended period.']
